name: Queso Catfish
author: FLOWERFROGGIRL
summary: A deliciously crunchy and spicy way to serve catfish inspired by a similar dish I had in Beaumont, TX.
directions: In a shallow dish, stir together 1/4 cup of lime juice and beer
Place fish in the dish, and turn to coat
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Coat a roasting rack with cooking spray, and place over a baking sheet
Rinse fish with cold water, and pat dry
In one dish, stir together the cornmeal, tortilla chip crumbs, salt and pepper
In another dish, stir together 2 tablespoons of lime juice and canola oil
Dip fillets into the lime and oil, then into the cornmeal mixture to coat
Place the fish onto the roasting rack
Bake fish for 8 to 10 minutes, or until it flakes easily with a fork
While the fish is baking, combine the processed cheese, chili powder, cumin, and chipotle pepper in a small saucepan over medium-low heat
Cook and stir until melted and smooth
Place fish onto serving plates, and spoon the cheese sauce over them
Top with a sprinkling of cilantro leaves, if desired
